intro: Trichotosia integra, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub with upright stems and produces clusters of violet or white flowers. It thrives in humid, well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Trichotosia integra is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
